thread.title: German public debt falling faster than expected - Spiegel

title: German public debt falling faster than expected - Spiegel
text:
April 7, 2018 / 2:46 PM / Updated 15 minutes ago German public debt falling faster than expected - Spiegel Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BERLIN (Reuters) - Germany’s public debt is falling faster than expected thanks to high tax revenues and should drop below the European Union’s target threshold next year, a year earlier than previously expected, magazine Der Spiegel reported on Saturday. 
Citing the government’s new stability programme, due to be agreed by the cabinet next Wednesday, Spiegel said the debt ratio was now projected to fall to just over 58 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) in 2019 from 61 percent this year. 
That would see the debt ratio drop below the EU Stability and Growth Pact threshold of 60 percent of GDP a year earlier than previously forecast. Writing by Paul Carrel; Editing by Hugh Lawson
